Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[README]" (#8461) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug

Clicking the Show More link clears the URL fragment and goes to the top of the page.

### To Reproduce

1. Go to https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/ICanHazReadme/1.0.1#show-readme-container
2. Click Show More
3. Wait a second

### Expected behavior

The README should expand but the viewport should stay where it is.

Actual: it jumps up.

### Screenshots

![repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/111713555-21536d00-880d-11eb-91f1-90fa6225b28b.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[README] Empty embedded readme breaks the manage package > documentation section" (#8460) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

I created a package with an empty README file. It seems to confuse the upload UI and the manage package Documentation section. It sort of looks like some of the code thinks it's a legacy readme package and other code thinks its an embedded readme.

### To Reproduce

Go here: https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/ICanHazReadme/1.0.2/Manage

Or

1. Create a nupkg with an embedded readme and make the readme empty (0 bytes)
2. Upload to Gallery
3. Notice the README preview on the upload package
4. After the package is uploaded, go to the Manage Package page and expand the Documentation section

### Expected behavior

Either the package should be rejected or the package should be considered to have an embedded readme and no Preview button should appear.

### Screenshots

No submit button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/111712721-71c9cb00-880b-11eb-8ed0-5522618fd639.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Readme] Images from untrusted domains are displayed from legacy readme" (#8459) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug
Only images from trusted domains should be displayed. However, images from untrusted domains are still displayed for legacy readmes.

For example: https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/Loshar.Readme/3.0.0

### To Reproduce

1. Upload a package that does not have an embedded readme
2. Add the following readme using the legacy readme feature: `![NuGet Logo](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/NuGet_project_logo.svg/220px-NuGet_project_logo.svg.png)`
3. Navigate to the package details page. The image is hosted by wikipedia.org which is not on the trusted domains list. It should not be rendered.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[README] Show more +/- is shown even if there is no additional content" (#8458) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

When the README is short (like 1-3 lines) the "Show more" / "Show less" links are shown but if you click on them they don't do anything.

### To Reproduce

1. Go to this package: https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/ICanHazReadme/1.0.0
2. Click "Show more" and "Show less"

### Expected behavior

The link should not appear for short READMEs.

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/111710428-ea7a5880-8806-11eb-94b3-ef11fe2a20b1.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Readme] UTF8 characters broken in preview but work in expanded mode" (#8457) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
UTF8 characters do not render properly in the README preview.

### To Reproduce

1. Go to: https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/Loshar.Readme/2.0.0#
1. Look at the Documentation (notice the ?):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/111708733-a2a60200-8803-11eb-8f53-0bb94d04f4d8.png)

1. Now press `+ Show more` (notice the emojis):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/111708768-afc2f100-8803-11eb-8a12-5dcb69b2a733.png)

### Expected behavior
UTF8 emojis should work in the preview mode.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Stats: Community Packages shows non-Community Packages #2" (#8456) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

The Community Packages shows non-Community Packages, see screenshot



url: https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. go to https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages


### Expected behavior
Not showing Microsoft packages when "Show all packages" isn't checked. Currently 3 microsoft.* packages are shown

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5808377/111561543-e9a8de80-8794-11eb-9d5c-0a7e3b9e43b6.png)



related: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7314

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Revert "Fix 3107 - Gallery UTs take a long time to finish."" (#3880) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Feature Request] Private feeds locked by an ApiKey" (#8455) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Current NuGet gallery is for public consumption - it's like a single, PUBLIC feed. 

Would love to have a the ability to create private feeds, locked by api keys (which already exist).

Currently we could:
- Use one of the -other- nuget server implementations that exist but this means we need to manage them (which most people don't need to want to manage anything, these days)
- Use a commercial product. This is good for businesses that making a profit/want extra security+complience/advanced features/etc ... but there's still a section of the community that don't need all of that and/or don't make money (but still would like private feeds).

So it would be really awesome if this could be a feature that could be considered.


(This idea was raised in #8314 )

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pack from Visual Studio doesn't work with embedded readme" (#10668) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: Visual Studio
Product version: private build 5.10.0.7298
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/_apis/resources/Containers/7402507/VS15?itemPath=VS15%2FNuGet.Tools.vsix

## Repro steps and/or sample project

1. Create a SDK-based project (class library targeting .NET Standard 2.0 is easy way)
1. Create a README.md file in the .project
1. Open the .csproj and edit it to look something like this:

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netstandard2.0</TargetFramework>
    <PackageReadmeFile>README.md</PackageReadmeFile>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Include="README.md" Pack="true" PackagePath="\"/>
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

Right click on the project node and click Pack.

Look in the produced .nupkg for a README.md ‚úîÔ∏è and for a `<readme>` element in the .nuspec ‚ö†Ô∏è.

The file is there but the .nuspec is not having the `<readme>` element.

Here is my example project: [ICanHazReadme.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/6167766/ICanHazReadme.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[QUESTION] How to use NuGet packages in a C++/CLI project?" (#10653) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a C++/CLI project which uses both native and managed code.

It is a common pattern where you have a native class implementation with core functionality, and a managed class exposed to external C# code. This managed class needs to use .Net NuGet packages, not native ones.

In Visual Studio 2019 16.9.0 when I try to add a NuGet package such as PCSC or NLog or Newtonsoft.Json to a C++/CLI project I am getting an error:
```
Could not install package 'PCSC 5.0.0'. You are trying to install this package into a project that targets 'native,Version=v0.0', but the package does not contain any assembly references or content files that are compatible with that framework. For more information, contact the package author.
```
In the project I am already providing the correct target for managed code:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16415478/110812557-01113480-8288-11eb-83ba-5fde0a1ff009.png)

Is there a way to override NuGet behavior for C++/CLI projects, apart from installing/restoring the package manually as a pre-build step using command line, and then specifying the package reference in the `.vcxproj` file (either manually or by using Add reference -> Browse):
```
<Reference Include="PCSC">
<HintPath>..\packages\PCSC.5.0.0\lib\net40\PCSC.dll</HintPath>
</Reference>
```
If there is no way to do that, then this issue should be considered a feature request instead of a question.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to install packages with NutGet on Ubuntu 18 [x86_64]" (#10635) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--

More information on our issue management policies can be found here: https://aka.ms/aspnet/issue-policies

Please keep in mind that the GitHub issue tracker is not intended as a general support forum, but for reporting **non-security** bugs and feature requests.

If you believe you have an issue that affects the SECURITY of the platform, please do NOT create an issue and instead email your issue details to secure@microsoft.com. Your report may be eligible for our [bug bounty](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/msrc/bounty-dot-net-core) but ONLY if it is reported through email.
For other types of questions, consider using [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com).

-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package Namespaces Proposal" (#55) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Introduction of a feature concept called Package Namespaces which allows a developer to include or exclude package IDs by specifying package namespaces on their package source(s).

üéâüì¶Please provide your comments, concerns, and feedback within this PR. üì¶üéâ

https://github.com/NuGet/Home/pull/10660

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom V2 OData queries will be deprecated March 9th, 2021 " (#54) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (#37) last year and conducted a dry run of the deprecation to ensure that there are no surprises for users (#40). 

We will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in March 9, 2021, as detailed in [the blogpost here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/custom-v2-odata-queries-will-be-deprecated-march-9-2021/).

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post.](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedBody: Adds issue & pr templates.

Events.RelatedBody:

```

/builds/company/modules/myproject/myproject/myproject.csproj : error NU3028: Package 'System.Security.Principal.Windows 4.5.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain 
.......
```
